articles.title: Reactable
articles.subtitle: A new way of conceiving a music live performance
articles.description: The Reactable is a revolutionary collaborative instrument composed of a round, translucent table that is usually situated in a dark room. The table is lit up, and blocks called "tangibles" are placed on the table by performers. The tangibles represent different modules of a synthesizer (such as sequencers and VCOs). Performers then manipulate the tangibles on the Reactable to create a custom digital song. As the tangibles move, they create motions and light movements on the table, making the Reactable both an instrument and visual display.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence and the Art of Mario Klingemann
articles.subtitle: Mario Klingemann is a German artist and Google Arts and Culture resident known for his work involving neural networks, code, and algorithms.
articles.description: He is considered a pioneer in the use of computer learning in the arts. His works examine creativity, culture, and perception through machine learning and artificial intelligence, and have appeared at the Ars Electronica Festival, the Museum of Modern Art New York, the Metropolitan Museum of Art New York, the Photographersâ€™ Gallery London, the Centre Pompidou Paris, and the British Library.
